SEARCH
Package main

Class Controller

java.lang.Object
main.Controller
All Implemented Interfaces:
Observer
public class Controller extends Object implements Observer
The `Controller` class is a central component responsible for managing the execution of actions using a set of invokers. It acts as an observer to capture metrics and provides methods for analyzing and printing the collected metrics.

      Returns:
      True if the distribution is successful, false otherwise.

      Updates the metrics with the provided list of metrics.

      Parameters:

    • updateMetricAsync

      public void updateMetricAsync(ArrayList<Future<Metric>> metrics)
      Updates the metrics asynchronously using threads and futures.
      Specified by:
      updateMetricAsync in interface Observer
      Parameters:
      metrics - The list of futures representing asynchronous metric updates.

    • getMetrics

      public ArrayList<Metric> getMetrics()
      Retrieves the collected metrics.
      Returns:
      The list of metrics collected during the execution.

    • analyzeExecutionTime

      public void analyzeExecutionTime(ArrayList<Metric> metrics)
      Analyzes the execution time metrics. It calculates the minimum, maximum, average, and total execution time for each action.
      Parameters:
      metrics - The list of metrics collected during the execution.

    • analyzeExecutionTimeBis

      public void analyzeExecutionTimeBis(ArrayList<Metric> metrics)
      Analyzes the execution time metrics using an alternative method. It calculates the minimum, maximum, average, and total execution time for each invoker.
      Parameters:
      metrics - The list of metrics collected during the execution.

    • analyzeInvokerMemory

      public void analyzeInvokerMemory(ArrayList<Metric> metrics)
      Analyzes the memory usage of each invoker based on the provided list of metrics. It calculates the total memory usage, percentage used, and prints the results for each invoker.
      Parameters:
      metrics - The list of metrics containing information about invoker memory usage.

    • printMetrics

      public void printMetrics()
      Prints the collected metrics, including action ID, execution time, invoker ID, and memory usage. The method retrieves the metrics using the `getMetrics` method.
